summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan regarding an upcoming telephone conference in the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case. The order addresses the sealing of juror questionnaires and voir dire materials and schedules discussion of jury selection logistics.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case referenced in the court order.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge issuing the order, scheduling a conference, and providing instructions regarding jury selection materials.

events.title: Telephone Conference on Jury Selection
events.description: A scheduled telephone conference where the court will discuss jury selection matters and logistics with the parties, including sealing requests for juror questionnaires and voir dire.

keyFacts: The document is a court order dated October 20, 2021, in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell (20-CR-330).
Judge Alison J. Nathan scheduled a telephone conference for October 21, 2021, to discuss jury selection logistics and sealing of juror questionnaires.
The parties made an unopposed request to seal their joint proposed juror questionnaire and voir dire (referencing Docket No. 339).
The court planned to transmit its draft questionnaire and voir dire to the parties via email for discussion at the conference.
The order indicates the procedural phase of jury selection was actively being managed by the court.
